Right Click A Panel
Right Click A Panel
Door Catalog Right Click A Panel
There are five options when Right Clicking on a Door Panel.
image1333.gif
Panel Type
The Panel Type option is a fly-out with seven options:
image1334.gif

None -   This menu option will remove the Door Panel from your Door. 
 
 
 Raised Panel -  This menu option will make your Door Panel a Raised Panel. 
 
 
 Flat Panel -  This menu option will make your Door Panel a Flat Panel. 
 
 
 Glass Panel -  This menu option will make your Door Panel a Glass Panel. 
 
 
 Horizontal Slats -  This menu option will make your Door Panel a Horizontal Panel. 
 
 
 Vertical Slats -  This menu option will make your Door Panel a Vertical Panel. 
 
 
 Slab -  This menu option will make your Door Panel a Slab Panel.
None -   This menu option will remove the Door Panel from your Door.
None -   This menu option will remove the Door Panel from your Door.
Raised Panel -  This menu option will make your Door Panel a Raised Panel.
Raised Panel -  This menu option will make your Door Panel a Raised Panel.
Flat Panel -  This menu option will make your Door Panel a Flat Panel.
Flat Panel -  This menu option will make your Door Panel a Flat Panel.
Glass Panel -  This menu option will make your Door Panel a Glass Panel.
Glass Panel -  This menu option will make your Door Panel a Glass Panel.
Horizontal Slats -  This menu option will make your Door Panel a Horizontal Panel.
Horizontal Slats -  This menu option will make your Door Panel a Horizontal Panel.
Vertical Slats -  This menu option will make your Door Panel a Vertical Panel.
Vertical Slats -  This menu option will make your Door Panel a Vertical Panel.
Slab -  This menu option will make your Door Panel a Slab Panel.
Slab -  This menu option will make your Door Panel a Slab Panel.
Lock Width
This menu option will lock the selected Panel's Width Dimension.
Lock Width locks the Width Dimension when the Door is used in Solid. It does not lock the Width in the Construction Tab preview of the Door.
Information.png
Lock Height
This menu option will lock the selected Panel's Height Dimension.
Lock Height locks the Height Dimension when the Door is used in Solid. It does not lock the Height in the Construction Tab preview of the Door.
Information.png
Delete Custom Route
This menu option will delete a Custom Route on the Panel if one exists.
Custom Route...
This menu option allows you to add a Custom Route to your Door Panel.
image283.gif
The Shape Editor has the following tools available when creating/editing a Custom Route:
Click the tools below for more information
image2353.gif
